com.amwe.bokbytarapp.ControllerView.MessagePage

Class MessageListAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
      • com.amwe.bokbytarapp.ControllerView.MessagePage.MessageListAdapter

  • public class MessageListAdapter
extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
    Author:
    Elias Johansson, William Hugo. Responsibilty: This class displays all the messages that exists inside a conversation between two users as a list. It is needed to use the Android RecyclerView, which it also inherits from. The messages look different depending on if it is sent or received by the current user. To do this it uses two inner classes: ReceivedMessageHolder and SentMessageHolder to differentiate between the two accordingly. Used by: MessageListPage. Uses: Database,Cryptography,IMessage,IMessageFactory,PrivateKey,SentMessageHolder,ReceivedMessageHolder

        Parameters:
        messages - a list of all the Strings that contain the messages of the current conversation. Cryptography is instantiated here to be able to be accessed in listeners.

    • Method Detail

      • getItemCount

        public int getItemCount()
        Getter for the size of the list. Used in the background.
        Specified by:
        getItemCount in class androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
        Returns:
        the size of the list containing the messages.

      • getItemViewType

        public int getItemViewType(int position)
        Compares the messages sender with current user. If they are equal, then the message has been sent by user. Otherwise by the contact.
        Overrides:
        getItemViewType in class androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
        Parameters:
        position, - index of the list.
        Returns:
        an int to represent if the message has been sent or received by the user.

        Method to allocate message from the database to a matching ViewHolder.

        position, - the index of the list.

      • onCreateViewHolder

        public androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(@NonNull
                                                                               android.view.ViewGroup parent,
                                                                               int viewType)
        Creates a new GUI entity to populate the recyclerview depending on if the message is sent or received by current user.
        Specified by:
        onCreateViewHolder in class androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
        Parameters:
        parent - Android class that is used to create a new card that holds the most recent message.
        viewType - is used to decide if the message is sent or received by sender.
        Returns:
        either a view that represents a new received message or sent message.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if viewType is not defined.
